channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Huawei is ‘still struggling,’ says founder Ren Zhengfei, as the tech company rebounds from years of sanctions
item.description: “Even now, we can’t say we’ve secured survival."

item.title: Chinese shopping platform Temu hit by EU investigation over illegal products and a ‘potentially addictive design’
item.description: Temu has on average around 92 million monthly active users in the European bloc. The investigation could lead to large fines.

item.title: Tim Cook hints users are rushing to download Apple Intelligence

item.description: Bring in the “three sisters” of Nicoya, Costa Rica to your longevity recipe.

item.description: U.S. leaders are more concerned about domestic regulation while their foreign counterparts are worried about tariffs.

item.title: How your business can make the most of abundant computing power in the age of AI
item.description: In what novel ways might leaders create, deliver, and capture value?

item.title: The stock market gives this candidate a 70% chance to be the next president
